{"step_by_step_thinking": "Choriocarcinoma is a type of gestational trophoblastic disease that is highly malignant. It is highly sensitive to chemotherapy, which is the first-line treatment. Dilatation and evacuation is a procedure used to manage miscarriage or abortion, not choriocarcinoma. Radiotherapy is not the first-line treatment for choriocarcinoma. Hysterectomy is a surgical procedure to remove the uterus, which is not the first choice of treatment for choriocarcinoma.", "answer_choice": "D. Chemotherapy"}
